item.title: Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones - The Indian Express
item.description:
Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Indian Express

This year's Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj marks a significant technological advancement with the introduction of the Digi Kumbh initiative, aiming to enhance security and management through AI and digital tools.

  • The event is expected to attract around 40 crore pilgrims.
  • Over 2,750 CCTV cameras will ensure comprehensive surveillance.
  • AI technology is being utilized to track crowd movements effectively.
  • This initiative is considered the largest face recognition exercise in India.
“I have been playing bhajans (hymns) and taking photos on my phone. Since there is no Internet, I cannot use any of the Kumbh apps,” said Vijaypuri Bapu, a naga sadhu.

The digital transformation at Maha Kumbh Mela represents a blend of tradition and technology, aiming for a safer and more organized gathering for millions.

item.title: Dense Fog Envelops Delhi-NCR Again, AQI Drops To "Severe" Category - NDTV
item.description:
Dense Fog Envelops North India, Over 150 Flights Delayed In Delhi

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: NDTV

A thick blanket of fog affected visibility in the Delhi-NCR region, leading to significant travel disruptions this morning, including delays for over 150 flights and 26 trains.

  • Visibility reduced to zero, causing delays averaging 41 minutes for flights.
  • The Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL) reported impacts on flight departures but assured CAT III-compliant flights could still operate.
  • The India Meteorological Department issued a fog warning for North India, spanning Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan.
  • Delhi's air quality index (AQI) was severe at 408, necessitating implementation of Stage 3 curbs under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP).
  • Temperatures in Delhi were recorded between 6 and 20 degrees Celsius.
“Hundreds of flights and trains have been cancelled or delayed due to thick fog in the past few weeks in North India.”

This weather event highlights the ongoing issues with air travel and pollution in the region as winter weather impacts visibility and health.

item.title: IIM Graduate Shares Ordeal Of Sister-In-Law's Extortion: Lost Jobs, Family Suffered Post 10-day Marriage - News18
item.description:
IIM Graduate Shares Ordeal Of Sister-In-Law's Extortion: Lost Jobs, Family Suffered Post 10-day Marriage

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: News18

Amid ongoing investigations regarding domestic violence and the suicide of Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash, Prathyusha Challa shares her family's experience of alleged extortion after her brother's brief marriage.

  • Prathyusha's brother married in 2019, but the marriage ended in just 10 days due to alleged extortion threats from his wife.
  • The IIM graduate claims her sister-in-law's family plotted a scheme to extort money after the marriage.
  • Challa notes a lack of investigation before a false domestic violence case (IPC 498) was filed against them.
  • Five years after the case, no trial has started, severely impacting her family, including health decline and professional setbacks.
  • The viral video has sparked discussions on the flaws in arranged marriages and laws favoring specific genders.
“She misbehaved with my parents, spoke foul language, and did not allow my brother to enter into his own bedroom,” Prathyusha Challa said regarding her sister-in-law.

The revelations from Prathyusha Challa bring attention to the personal and societal implications of marriage and the judicial system, often leading to severe consequences for families involved in false allegations.
